intro: Staehelina corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered starflower, is a member of the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. The plant features small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Staehelina corymbosa is adapted to cool, moist environments and thrives in partial shade.
